result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle L. Marten was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
DNA sample

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michelle L. Marten

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: (Balance of DOC assessment modified to zero)
and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Hearing, and Order Extending Probation For Unpaid Court Obligations

Defendant Michelle L. Marten in court with attorney Gary Stephen Dodge.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 9:28 a.m. Agreement stated - Def will plead to charge, withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, court costs. State has complied with VWNR. Atty Dodge and Def agree. Plea quest. reviewed. Plea to ct 1 retail theft - guilty. Constitutional rights, elements and penalties reviewed. Atty Dodge satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Plea accepted and Court finds guilty. Sentencing remarks by Counsel. Statement by Defendant. Remarks by the Court. Will follow agreement. Sentence withheld, 1 yr probation, court costs, apply bond. DNA sample. No credit if revoked.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Postconviction rights.

Defendant Michelle L. Marten in court with attorney Gary Stephen Dodge.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint reviewed.  Not guilty plea entered.  Court will accept plea.   Bond will continue with condition  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Michelle L. Marten in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def has copy of complaint.  Court reads charge with possible penalties.  Def advised of right to an attorney.   State request $200 cash bond with condition.  Bond set by court  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
